<a href="http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1579306/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1579306/</a>																																									Hoping to make a better life for herself, recent divorcee Dana Marshall (Lori Loughlin) and her son, Jared (Charles Henry Wyson), move across the country to live with DanaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s mother, Louise (Stefanie Powers), in California. When Jared's fourth-grade class is assigned to write letters to soldiers serving overseas, he finds a new friend, Vince (Johnny Messner). JaredÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s letters hit home with Vince, and the two continue to write back and forth. 
When Vince returns on leave and decides to pay a surprise visit to his 10-year-old pen pal, his arrival has unexpected consequences. Dana's new relationship with Vince complicates life for the whole family. How will they handle the future?																																																										LORI LOUGHLIN (Dana Marshall) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Best recognized for her role as Rebecca Donaldson on the long-running hit comedy series Ã¢â‚¬Å“Full House,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Lori Loughlin has now added another iconic series to her resume: The CWÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s new incarnation of Ã¢â‚¬Å“90210.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ In it, she plays the mother of two teenagers who struggles with her familyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s move from the normalcy of Kansas to the fast lane of Beverly Hills. Her most recent film project was the 2009 comedy feature Ã¢â‚¬Å“Old Dogs,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ in which she stars opposite Robin Williams and John Travolta, playing the latterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s love interest.  Her other recent feature film was Ã¢â‚¬Å“Moondance Alexander,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ in which she portrayed an eccentric mother whose daughter finds a pony and is determined to win the Bow Valley Classic. 
Born and raised in Hauppauge, Long Island, Loughlin got her start in show business at a young age. She was cast in the daytime drama Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Edge of Night,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ for which she received a Young Artist Award nomination for Best Young Actress in a Daytime Series. 
In 1985, Loughlin was cast in the feature film Ã¢â‚¬Å“Secret Admirer,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ a romantic comedy co-starring C. Thomas Howell and Kelly Preston. Loughlin also starred opposite Treat Williams in Ã¢â‚¬Å“Critical Mass,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ in the beach movie spoof Ã¢â‚¬Å“Back to the Beach,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ in Ã¢â‚¬Å“Rad,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ a film about BMX racing, and in Ã¢â‚¬Å“Amityville 3-D,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ the third installment of the Ã¢â‚¬Å“AmityvilleÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ horror franchise. 
In addition to Ã¢â‚¬Å“Full House,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Loughlin was a regular on Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hudson Street,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ a comedy starring Tony Danza. She was also the star and producer of The WBÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s family drama Ã¢â‚¬Å“Summerland.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Other television roles have included an after-school special entitled Ã¢â‚¬Å“No Means No,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ for which she received an EmmyÃ‚Â® nomination for Best Actress. Loughlin also worked with Jim Carrey in the TV movie Ã¢â‚¬Å“Doing Time on Maple DriveÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and starred in Ã¢â‚¬Å“In the Line of Duty: Blaze of Glory.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ She has made repeat performances in a number of series, including Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Drew Carey ShowÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Spin City,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ and guest-starred in such series as Ã¢â‚¬Å“Seinfeld,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Suddenly Susan,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Larry Sanders ShowÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Birds of Prey.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ 
Loughlin resides in Los Angeles with her husband, fashion designer Mossimo Giannulli, and their three children. 																																																												JOHNNY MESSNER (Sergeant Vince Carrera) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ After a role in Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Sweetest ThingÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ with Cameron Diaz and Selma Blair, Johnny Messner caught the attention of numerous industry-types with his breakthrough role as the mohawked special-ops lieutenant John Lake in Ã¢â‚¬Å“Tears of the Sun,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ opposite Bruce Willis and Monica Bellucci. His work in Ã¢â‚¬Å“TearsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ caught the attention of director Dwight Little, who cast him in Sony PicturesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Anacondas.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½  In the film, he starred as a conflicted American loner with a checkered past who unwittingly becomes the boat captain to a disparate group of doomed travelers in the South Pacific. 
His other credits include films such as Ã¢â‚¬Å“Running Scared,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ the New Line feature directed by Wayne Kramer, in which he co-starred with Paul Walker and Vera Farmiga, Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Whole Ten Yards,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ David MametÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬Å“SpartanÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ opposite Val Kilmer and William H. Macy, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hostage,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ his third collaboration with Bruce Willis, and, most recently, Ã¢â‚¬Å“CorradoÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wrong Turn at Tahoe.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ 
Messner is proud of his contribution to Ã¢â‚¬Å“One Last Thing,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ which debuted at the 2006 Tribeca Film Festival. In the film, he plays Jason OÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Malley, the football star poised to assume the role of hero to fulfill a dying young teenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s last wish. As the story unfolds, OÃ¢â‚¬â„¢Malley develops a poignant relationship with the boyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s single mom, played by Cynthia Nixon. 
No stranger to the small screen, MessnerÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s television credits include the lead role on the Fox drama Ã¢â‚¬Å“Killer Instinct,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ a recurring role on Ã¢â‚¬Å“The O.C.,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ and guest star appearances in shows such as Ã¢â‚¬Å“C.S.I.,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Knight RiderÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Law & Order.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ 
Messner lived in Europe for several years while his father served in the U.S. Air Force. He went to high school in Newburyport, Massachusetts, and attended college at San Diego State University, earning a degree in communications. He currently resides in Los Angeles. 																																						STEFANIE POWERS (Louise Metcalf) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Stefanie Powers began her career at age 15, dancing briefly for famed choreographer Jerome Robbins. Under contract to Columbia Pictures for five years, she appeared in 15 motion pictures, including Ã¢â‚¬Å“Experiment in Terror,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬Å“The InternsÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Love Has Many Faces,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ before landing her first TV series, Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Girl from U.N.C.L.E.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ 
More motion pictures followed, plus dozens of TV guest appearances, more than 20 mini-series including Ã¢â‚¬Å“MistralÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Daughter,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬Å“At MotherÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s RequestÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Beryl Markham: A Shadow on the Sun,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ and tours in theatrical productions such as Under the Yum Yum Tree, How the Other Half Loves, Sabrina, A View From the Bridge, Oliver! and Annie Get Your Gun. 
Two more television series, Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Feather & Father GangÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and the long-running Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hart to HartÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ established PowersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ reputation for glamour and versatility. For her performance in Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hart to Hart,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Powers garnered two EmmyÃ‚Â® nominations and five Golden Globe nominations. She toured extensively with Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hart to HartÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ co-star Robert Wagner in Love Letters, including the playÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s London West End run and returned to the West End in the musical Matador. After completing eight two-hour television movie versions of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hart to Hart,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ she returned to the musical theater in the first revival of Applause, the musical version of All About Eve. She appeared Off-Broadway in The Vagina Monologues before returning to England to star in the debut of the American play, The Adjustment. 
England summoned her again to take over for Elaine Page in the elaborate UK production of The King and I, and a year later she returned to the role of Anna in the US tour of the production. Again in England, she appeared in the comedy film Ã¢â‚¬Å“Rabbit Fever,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ followed by a dramatic film production Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jump,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ shot in Austria.  She released her debut CD, Ã¢â‚¬Å“On the Same Page,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ a collection of tunes from the classic American songbook era, a collaboration with musician Page Cavanaugh, and followed that with her one-woman show, One From the Hart. 
As much a part of her life as her career is, PowersÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ devotion to animal preservation and protection often seems more of a vocation than an avocation. She is the co-founder and president of the William Holden Wildlife Foundation, established in 1982 as a public charity to continue the late actorÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s conservation work in Africa. Powers resides part-time in Kenya, serves on the advisory board of three major zoos, is a Fellow of the Los Angeles Zoo, the Royal Geographic Society and the Explorers Club of America, and she created the Jaguar Conservation Trust for Jaguar Cars North America, all as part of her lifetime commitment to conservation. 
Powers recently signed with Simon and Schuster to write her memoir, which is set to be released in 2010.
